title: Vase, 1901
markings:
Artist's monogram incised on bottom, underglaze.  Also G.(designates Green glaze)

Impressed on bottom, underglaze: RP cipher with 14 flames, I beneath, also, 888C.
provenance:
Jordan-Volpe Gallery, New York
Marcia and William Goodman

Marcia and William Goodman
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description:
Sea green bulbous tapered vase with floral decoration.
White clay body, thrown. Low bulbous body with tall wide neck, slightly incurving lip; flat foot. Underglaze slip-decorated with branches of dogwood blossoms around body and neck. Light blue background with light green flowers and leaves. Very light green glaze overall; cracklature. Interior and bottom glazed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Vase, 1901.
1901. Glazed earthenware. Gift of Marcia and William Goodman. 1984-84-17.
